metadata.title: CVE-2017-9462 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In Mercurial before 4.1.3, "hg serve --stdio" allows remote authenticatedusers to launch the Python debugger, and consequently execute arbitrarycode, by using --debugger as a repository name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

mercurial - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
mercurial-common - 2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mercurial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.8.2-1ubuntu1.4').
